snippet: Many employers in states that have legalized recreational or medical marijuana are penalizing workers for off-premise activity that is legal.
abstract: Editorial calls on businesses to end their zero-tolerance marijuana policies, especially in states that have legalized medical or recreational forms of the drug; points out marijuana is less harmful than alcohol, and has not been shown to broadly affect work habits, so long as workers arrive sober to their jobs.
lead_paragraph: Many employers in states that have legalized recreational or medical marijuana are penalizing workers for off-premise activity that is legal.
